name: TowGeom Input File
summary: Learn about .TGI files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Degi Trans TowGeom is an online program that allows engineers to quickly create 3D and 2D models of transmission towers. While designing a tower, engineers can enter inputs that create that tower's geometry. They can then save these inputs as TGI files.

Each TGI file contains data about a tower's panels, including the panels' number, height, and pattern name, and slopes, including the number of slopes and their widths. TowGeom's pattern library includes pre-existing tower geometry patterns, which engineers can load in TowGeom.

instructions: You can open a TGI file in TowGeom (Web) to view the tower geometry it contains and see that geometry displayed as a 3D model. You can also open a TGI file in Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (Mac), or any other text editor, to view tower geometry it contains.
